Turzil is absolutely terrified of the concept of having emotions, but is extremely glad he is, like all Engis, completely incapable of feeling strongly about anything. This has all left you very confused.
It seems Turzil has stuck a number of yellow sheets of paper onto the walls of his room. You ask about it, and he just complains about the lack of paint aboard the ship.

Turzil misses Tully quite a bit. The last time the two saw each other was several decades ago during the Last Stand at Node 17. You ask if it's usual for Engi to feel such things, and he immediately tenses up and gets defensive.

Out of cursiosity, you question Turzil about Engi ships and reproduction. Turzil looks at you strangely but provides a long and boring lecture about how Engi ships are technically 'alive' and exchange matter similar to normal biological reproduction. It's honestly quite mundane, nothing like the crazy tales you frequently hear other Renegades sharing.

You ask Turzil why he and other Separatists have different colors from normal Engis. Turzil explains that the concept of dyeing your nanites different colors to distinguish yourself has been a long lasting Separatist tradition. What Turzil doesn't explain however is why he has chosen to paint himself blue and yellow.

You find Turzil staring out one of the ship's rear windows, watching a comet fly past. "Curious. I have heard [stories] that many creatures... place... -wishes-? Yes, wishes, upon these frozen bodies of ice and dust. I have tried doing the [same]. Will it come true? I hope so..."
Turzil is pacing around one of the exterior doors to the cargo bay. When he spots you watching him, he stops and returns back to the ship, giving you a suspicious look that you match.

You go to question Turzil about why you've found a number of strange geometric scribbles lodged in various parts of the ship, but he is nowhere to be found. Strangely, whenever you go to ask him a question like this, he always disappears.

You find Turzil playing around with several electrical wires. You warn him not to screw with the ship, but it's too late. The ship goes black and Turzil vibrates with an electric shock. For a few moments, you swear the shield of the entire ship turns yellow, but after a few seconds it goes back to the normal blue, and the lights come back on.

Turzil worries sometimes about his maniac habits. It's not unusual for Separatists to exhibit strange characteristics after liberation, but Turzil cannot help but constantly obsess over the color yellow and paint. He hopes he is not going insane. Or becoming an artist.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ZOLTAN
event.text: What do you want to do with your Zoltan?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ZOLTAN_SCAN
event.text: ZOLTAN DETAILS SPECIES? [Zoltan] SUBTYPE? [No] Subtype Details: Genetic, Standard Stats: 75 Health, provides 1 power. On Death: 15 damage to enemy crew

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_ZOLTAN
textList.text: Your Zoltan requests that you study the Zoltan code of law in better detail.
Your Zoltan promises they would never lie unless it was absolutely necessary.
Your Zoltan makes it clear that they disapprove of all this violence.
Your Zoltan requests that you do not force it to stand in the same room all day.
Your Zoltan inquires about your definition of happiness. It tells you that you gave it a really lame answer.
Your Zoltan tells you that there are no stupid questions, but there are plenty of annoying ones.
You ask what it's like to be made of pure energy. Your Zoltan laughs and informs you that it is only composed of 98% energy.
Your Zoltan thinks you can never have too many Beams aboard your ship.
Your Zoltan questions the ethics of murdering enemy crew, and wishes everyone could just get along.
Your Zoltan tries to get into a conversation involving politics with you, but you assure them you have important things to do and hide in your quarters.
Your Zoltan wishes that you would avoid killing Engi ships as much as possible. Killing Rebels however, it can understand.
Your Zoltan expresses concerns around the Duskbringer uprising in the Zoltan sectors. You try to assure them that once the Rebellion is dealt with, the Federation will be able to help.
Your Zoltan is curious how the Coalition formed between the 4 more aggressive races in the galaxy.
Your Zoltan encourages that you enforce proper hygiene among the crew.
Your Zoltan tells you that he's always looked up to the monks who spend their entire lives practicing pacifism.
Your Zoltan wishes you would brush your teeth more often.
Your Zoltan doesn't understand why he must be limited to a humanoid form, but is unable to reshape himself.
Your Zoltan hopes you won't keep him in the shields for eternity.
You go to shake your Zoltan's hand, but pull away in pain when you're zapped. Your Zoltan apologizes.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_PEACE
event.text: What do you want to do with your Zoltan Peacekeeper?

choice.text: Have your Peacekeeper help with upgrading the reactor.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_PEACE_SCAN
event.text: PEACEKEEPER DETAILS SPECIES? [Zoltan] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite Stats: 65 Health, x1.25 combat damage, 0.65x combat damage taken, provides 2 power On Death: 30 damage to enemy crew, one ion damage to system (both enemy or player ship)

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_PEACE_UPGRADE_REACTOR
event.text: Your Peacekeeper, being an entity made of energy, knows a thing or two about power. They can upgrade the reactor for cheaper than normal.

choice.text: Your reactor is too weak for your Peacekeeper to help.

event.text: Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the reactor.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the reactor.

choice.text: Your reactor is too powerful for your Peacekeeper to work on it.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_PEACE
textList.text: Your Peacekeeper orders you to drop down and do twenty push-ups, and when you remind them that you are the captain, they drop down and give you fourty instead.
Your Peacekeeper is busy trying to get the other crew to stand in a straight line while waiting to get food.
Your Peacekeeper suggests putting them in the shields to prevent Ion damage.
Your Peacekeeper finds no irony in their title, and refuses to talk to you about it.
Your Peacekeeper elects themselves as the ship's mediator for any debates that may occur.
Your Peacekeeper boasts how Zoltans are the only race with 4 different color schemes.
Your Peacekeeper takes pride in their daily routine and excellent self-hygiene.
Your Peacekeeper thinks automated vessels are an excellent way of managing the commonwealth without putting crew at risk.
Your Peacekeeper warns you to disregard their description, and they will absolutely never kick you in the teeth.
Your Peacekeeper suggests that you exercise better control over the rest of the crew.
Your Peacekeeper hopes you will hurry with the mission, because they have a job to do watching over the citizens of the Zoltan Capital.
Your Peacekeeper is busy brainstorming ways to perform genocide on the pirate clans.
The computer informs you that your Peacekeeper is comatose in their quarters after fainting from powering the systems for too long.

Your Peacekeeper explains that the eye symbol on the Peacekeeper ships represents the Great Eye, a monolith constructed near a giant nebula resembling an eye in Zoltan territory. No one knows where the monolith came from.
Your Peacekeeper's favourite color is green. No surprise there.
Your Peacekeeper explains standard Zoltan ships are used for both civilian and military vessels, and sometimes even the two at the same time.
Your Peacekeeper was close to a promotion before they joined your crew. Or at least, so they claim.
Your Peacekeeper is busy taking a political-compass test.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_MONK
event.text: What do you want to do with your Monk?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_MONK_SCAN
event.text: MONK DETAILS SPECIES? [Zoltan] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard Stats: Cannot fight or sabotage. Inherited Stats: 75 Health, provides 1 power. On Death: 15 damage and 4s of stun to enemy crew Ability (27s cooldown): 10s of stun to all crew in the room excluding themselves. Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_MONK
textList.text: Your Monk wishes for galactic peace. You try your hardest to control the urge to explain why that's impossible.
Your Monk repeats a random cryptic proverb and walks away.
Your Monk is busy meditating. You decide not to disturb them.
Your Monk is busy ironing out their robe. You decide not to disturb them.
Your Monk explains that after years of practice, they have managed to take control over the energy that makes up their body.
You quietly wonder how your Monk's robe manages to stay on all the time.
No matter how much you plead or reason, your Monk refuses to harm another being.
Your Monk recommends that you try going vegan.
Your Monk suggests attempting to negotiate with enemies rather than killing them.
Your Monk thinks the Monk ship design is the coolest of the Zoltan color schemes.
Your Monk sees no shame in hiding behind other people while they do the fighting.
Your Monk requests that you lecture the other crew on referring to them as a coward.
Your Monk finds mobility hard in their robe, sometimes wishing they could swap it out for something much lighter weight.
Your Monk admonishes other Monks who use Ion tech on their ships, claiming even the seemingly harmless Ion weapons can be used to kill.
Your Monk admires the religious nature of the Rock people, and their dedication to their faith.
Your Monk believes the Zoltan church system is corrupt and greedy, and that money is merely the fuel for selfish desires.
In case it wasn't clear, your Monk is a pacifist. They make sure to tell you this, multiple times.
Your Monk confesses to you that they once accidentally killed a bug that was bothering them, and breaks down into tears.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_BOMBER
event.text: What do you want to do with your Devotee?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_BOMBER_SCAN
event.text: DEVOTEE DETAILS SPECIES? [ZOLTAN] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard Stats: Learns combat and repair skills 20% faster Inherited Stats: 75 Health, provides 1 power On Death: 15 damage to enemy crew Ability (8s cooldown): Immediately kills self, triggering death effect. Also does additional 15 damage and 3 seconds of stun to all crew in the room. Ability cooldown type: Resets on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_BOMBER
textList.text: Your Devotee hates you, but they won't pass up a chance at glory in battle.
Your Devotee ponders the irony of them working for you.
Your Devotee complains about their uniform only having two colors when their ships are always so colorful.
Your Devotee finds humans insultingly stupid.
Your Devotee idly wonders if the Zoltans should join the Coalition after they take control of the Zoltan government.
Your Devotee warns you that they are only helping the Federation because the Rebellion is just as big of a threat to the Duskbringers as well.
Your Devotee no longer fears death... so long as there's a Clone Bay on the ship.
Your Devotee admits that sometimes, very very very rarely, you can be slightly cool.
Your Devotee is busy being edgy and pouting in their quarters.
Your Devotee is busy practicing poetry alone in their quarters.
Your Devotee recommends installing more Energy tech on the ship.
Your Devotee is trying to design a new Duskbringer ship, but simply cannot decide on what combination of colors to use in what order.
Your Devotee slaps you in the face and walks off. You consider punishing them, but decide it's better to let them die in battle sometime instead.
Your Devotee warns you to think of them higher than a walking bomb.
Your Devotee can still hear the screams. They won't elaborate further.
Your Devotee promises not to plot your own assassination until after the mission.
Your Devotee talks in great lengths about how disgusting the Federation color-scheme is.
Your Devotee advises you move the other crew out of the room in combat before they activate their kamikaze explosion.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_RADICAL
event.text: What do you want to do with your Martyr?

choice.text: Have your Martyr help with upgrading the Clone Bay.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_RADICAL_SCAN
event.text: Martyr DETAILS SPECIES? [ZOLTAN] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite Stats: Learns combat and repair skills 20% faster, does not lose skills from cloning Inherited Stats: 75 Health, provides 1 power On Death: 15 damage to enemy crew Ability (7s cooldown): Starts a cooldown that lasts 3 seconds, where it cannot move. Upon detonation instantly kills self, triggering death effect. Also does additional 30 damage and 5 seconds of stun to all crew in the room. Ability cooldown type: Resets on jump.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_RADICAL_UPGRADE_CLONEBAY
event.text: The Clone Bay is a vital system to the Duskbringers' tactics, and your Martyr is very familiar with using one. They can upgrade the system for cheaper than normal.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.

choice.text: Your Clone Bay is too powerful for your Martyr to work on it.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_RADICAL
textList.text: Your Martyr is surprisingly okay with working on a Federation ship. You guess a lot of the Duskbringer bravado really is just for show.
Your Martyr is practicing their marching, much to the displeasure of the other crew, who are constantly disrupted by shouts and salutations from the Martyr as they pass by.
Your Martyr stands up straight and salutes as you walk by. You've tried telling them several times it isn't necessary, but it's hard to break old habits apparently.
Your Martyr confesses working for you is a lot more favorable, mostly because you don't shoot crew in the foot when they accidentally leave formation a few seconds early.
Your Martyr hopes to optimize their bomb pack to reduce the cooldown even further, so that they might be an even more efficient suicide killer.
Your Martyr is ironing their robes. While you watch, they explain the meanings of various badges they've earned over the years.
Your Martyr makes a particularly edgy joke, which offends one of the other crew. You almost end up with a fight on your hands, but manage to calm down the two sides.
Your Martyr has become more accepting of the Federation lately, but still finds the color scheme of their ships disgusting.
Your Martyr despises the Rebellion more than they ever did the Federation. Though the Duskbringer leaders might have allied with Vance, your Martyr doesn't trust the Rebellion at all.
Your Martyr gets into a long conversation with you on why the word "capitol" should be spelled with an O instead of an A.
You can't find your Martyr, so you take a look into their quarters, where you find several fake toothbrush mustaches and a black hat with a skull on it.
Your Martyr finds it very important to stay in shape, despite being a being of energy without muscles to exercise.
Your Martyr doesn't care what anyone says, they will always think the Martyr uniform is the most bad-ass of any out there.
Your Martyr wonders how offensive the jokes they tell can get until they're kicked off the ship or murdered by one of the crew. You encourage them not to try and find out.
Your Martyr accidentally trips over their robes, then stumbles before you on their knees and begs for forgiveness for showing signs of "graceless-ness" in front of you.
Your Martyr hopes to obtain an old Earth pistol or knife to complete their look. Or maybe a tank.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_MANTIS
event.text: What do you want to do with your Mantis?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_MANTIS_SCAN
event.text: MANTIS DETAILS SPECIES? [Mantis] SUBTYPE? [No] Subtype Details: Genetic, Standard Stats: x1.5 combat damage, x1.2 move speed, x0.5 repair speed.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_MANTIS
textList.text: Your Mantis thinks of you as a friend. Friendship in their mind is determined by how many enemies you kill together.
Your Mantis asks if you will consider replacing the water in the showers with blood. You refuse.
Your Mantis assures you that they speak perfect English. You aren't sure, but you know better than to debate with them.
Your Mantis encourages you to hire more slaves, as they make good free crew.
Your Mantis hopes you will take it upon yourself to hold more combat training sessions.
Your Mantis asks if you think of yourself as a well-trained warrior. You debate about how you should answer in your head for several minutes before the Mantis gets bored and walks away.
Your Mantis brags about how many aliens it has killed since they were first born. You nod nervously.
You spot your Mantis sharpening its claws on the walls. You start to reprimand it before you reconsider.

You ask your Mantis about life in the Hive. For once, you see a personal side to your Mantis, and they tell you a long detailed story of their hardships in the Hive and the brutal inhuman treatment that it and its brethren received.
Your Mantis wants your crew to stop bathing so much, because the natural layer of dead skin and grime starts to create an organic layer of protection.
Your Mantis hacks up a large puddle of acid onto the floor. They apologize, then wobble away. You step carefully around the puddle and make a mental note to clean it up later.
Your Mantis explains that they never feel incompetent with their inability at repairs. That's what slaves are for, anyways.

You ask your Mantis whether they prefer Brains or Brawns, thinking you already know the answer. However to your surprise the Mantis says brains, but then explains that without brains, there would be no worthless Engi slaves to clean up the Mantis's bloody messes.
Your Mantis wishes to die in the midst of battle, soaked in the blood of its enemies and 5 or 6 female Mantis swooning behind them.
Your Mantis explains that they desire to learn the art of debate, so that they can distract their opponents in conversation before killing them.
Your Mantis likes to paint. They don't want to talk about it any further.
Your Mantis tells you they had 2 options in life. Join the Coalition or stay in the Hive. They chose to join the Federation instead.
Your Mantis wants you to invest in Teleporter tech.
Your Mantis tells you an interesting story about how the very first bomb was actually created by a Mantis scientist.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_FREEMANTIS
event.text: What do you want to do with your Free Mantis?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_FREEMANTIS_SCAN
event.text: FREE MANTIS DETAILS SPECIES? [Mantis] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard Stats: x1.2 combat damage Inherited Stats: x0.5 repair speed Ability (17s cooldown, 7s duration): Temporarily boosts movement speed to x3.0 and combat damage to x2.2 Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: Your Free Mantis has set up a small lab in their quarters for producing more synthetic pheromones. To date since they joined the crew, it has triggered over 73 fire alarms.
You question your Free Mantis on whether it's really safe to be using their pheromones. Your Free Mantis has nothing to offer other than a shrug.
Your Free Mantis complains about how bright the ship lights are. They've also started investing in tinted sunglasses and a tailored Mantis hoodie.
Your Free Mantis hugs you aggressively, knocking you to the floor. You have to drag yourself back to the bridge with them attached to you before they finally let go and walk away satisfied.
Though your Free Mantis cannot be found anywhere, you do find a small shrine with pictures of your face tucked away in a corner of their quarters.
Your Free Mantis brings you the decapitated head of a Hive Mantis they've been carrying with them all this way. You're disgusted, but you know better than to reject the gift.
Your Free Mantis spots you and races to catch up, but trips over itself and runs head-first into a wall.
You find your Free Mantis in the recreation room watching tapes of your last battle over and over again, completely infatuated by them.
Your Free Mantis hopes to travel to Universe 0 some day and witness the home of the Federation themselves.
Your Free Mantis explains the concoction used in their pheromones has developed over several decades. With each generation the scientists get dumber, but somehow the pheromones only get better.
Your Free Mantis is terrified of the dark. They refuse to look out the ship windows because of it.
Your Free Mantis isn't sure how their ships get built when they don't use slaves but are about as bad at engineering as the Hive is.
Your Free Mantis is starting to wonder if the pheromones might be having negative effects on them. Probably not though, that would be ridiculous.

You find several drafts of a story hidden away in your Free Mantis's room. A quick glance reveals it's a fan fiction, titled "How I married the captain and defeated the entire Zoltan Ministry and Rebellion all by myself: Part 1," though with a lot more typos.
Your Free Mantis hopes you haven't been digging around in their room, though they won't say why.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_WARLORD
event.text: What do you want to do with your Warlord?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_WARLORD_SCAN
event.text: WARLORD DETAILS SPECIES? [Mantis] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite Stats: 90 Health, x0.8 damage taken from combat Inherited Stats: x0.5 repair speed Ability (15s cooldown, lasts 9 seconds): Self health -7, temporarily boosts movement speed to x5.0 and combat damage to x3.5 Ability reqs: Minimum of 10 health Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_WARLORD
textList.text: Your Warlord hopes the mutation of the Free Mantis head plate hasn't been a side effect of the pheromones, though it probably was. Can't be that bad though, right?
You find your Warlord completely comatose and unmoving. However, imitating the clicking of a Hive Mantis seems to break them out of their stupor and put them into a combat stance.
Your Warlord has some particularly vulgar things to say about the Zoltan Minister and his cabinet.
Your Warlord requests some scrap to spend on additional pheromones for their supply. You decline, knowing game logic will let them use their ability with endless supply.

Your Warlord randomly starts screaming, clawing at themselves and yelling about demons. They promptly shake themselves off of it, and pretend not to recall the event whenever you ask them about it afterwards.
Your Warlord can slowly feel its brain cells rotting away with every hit of pheromones it takes. Not that it intends to stop any time soon.

Your Warlord claims it takes some getting used to the smell and taste of synthetic pheromones, but soon enough you'll be completely addicted and dependent on them. You aren't really sure why that's a good thing.
Your Warlord has nothing to say, though you aren't sure if it's because they really don't, or the damage dealt to their brain is just taking its toll.
You notice your Warlord periodically loses focus during a conversation and randomly changes topics. That's probably fine, right?

Your Warlord will kill any foe that dares counter you or the Federation, whether it be Rebel, Zoltan, the Hive, a fellow Free Mantis, a large asteroid, a class-M star, a fleet of murderous space wombats, or the crushing existential dread that plagues our lives.
Your Warlord randomly spouts a bit of philosophical wisdom, then goes back to being a drugged up idiot.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_FREDDY
event.text: What do you want to do with Freddy?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_FREDDY_SCAN
event.text: FREDDY DETAILS SPECIES? [Mantis] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite Stats: x2.0 combat damage, x1.65 movement speed, 0.7x combat damage taken Ability (25 cooldown, 10s duration): Activates the pheromone effect for allied Mantis crew in the room. Does not stack with their actual ability, but does not reset their cooldown either. Standard Hive Mantis will use the Free Mantis effect. Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_FREDDY
textList.text: You find Freddy scribbling away in a small notebook of his. You ask him about it, to which he responds, "It's a journal, where I practice the different galactic dialects I've been learning. Could you help me, actually, captain? See, the rule is 'i before e except after c', yet there are dozens of contradictions. I'm terribly confused."

You wonder why Freddy is one of the only intelligent Free Mantis you've seen. "Oh, captain, I'm far from the only one. But those whom have stayed away from the influence of the pheromones tend to also stay away from the rest of the Galaxy. They live in far larger capital vessels and usually colonize the rims of dead space. That life just wasn't for me."
Freddy approaches you and asks for your opinion on different styles of hats for him to wear. You advise him to, no matter what, stay away from a fedora.

Freddy is quite proud of his decorated shield. "I stole this from a Bishop by the name of Kyiiiapitet. That was the day the Free Mantis began to revere me as their leader. It was also the day the Hive forbade the importation of tea. Spiteful bastards."

Freddy doesn't seem to talk much of his days before or during the Federation-Mantis War. After some prodding he does reveal he was responsible largely for the development of the first drone systems aboard Suzerain vessels.
"It has been so long since I have last consistently spoken native Yetiiik, I can barely remember how to pronounce my native name. 'Tiifleeiiik'. Egh."

"Perhaps there's a reality out there where the Mantis never attacked Earth. Do you think the Rebellion would have still happened? Would any of this have happened? Some days I wonder if I'll ever be able to find a reality where people actually live in peace."

"We'll have to sit and have tea together some time, captain. I understand the mission is important, but surely we'll have time eventually. Or maybe just sit and listen to music, if tea isn't your thing."

You ask how Freddy developed his love for tea. "Hah. Hardly a love. Damn stuff's more addicting than the pheromones that turned my brethren into mouthbreathers, and it tastes awful too. I just drink it because it makes me look fancy. Humans have awful cuisine, but somehow it spreads like wildfire."

"Do you ever experience existential dread at the sight of your own appendages? I frequently have panic attacks when I look down and see my hands have been replaced with swords, until I realize they're not swords at all. What I wouldn't do to have opposable thumbs."

It seems Freddy is quite the linguistics expert. Not only can he fluently speak the native languages of both Humans and Mantis, but he can also translate Zoltan, Orchid Florals (as well as a bit of Vampweed thanks to the similarities), Rockmen, and even a little Lanius. The only language he's yet to attempt is Engi. He just can't pronounce the beeping properly.

"I sometimes wonder what happened to the rest of the survivors I escaped with during the war. I hope they didn't get old like me. I might not show it, captain, but this old mantis has seen better days. It's just very fortunate we don't have wrinkles."

You watch Freddy elegantly pick up a welding torch and get to work with coordination far more proficiently than ordinary Mantis. "Tools within the Hive are traditionally specialized for use with claws, but aboard other vessels it can be a struggle. It takes a lot of practice, but if I'm any proof, it's certainly possible to operate with these things nonetheless."

You find Freddy flushing some strange liquid down the ship's toilet. "Don't worry about it, the smell will dissipate in an hour. Can't seem to perfect the concoction. Some day I'll find a pheromone formula that doesn't rapidly degrade your brain cells."

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_KAZ
event.text: What do you want to do with Kazaaakplethkilik?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_KAZ_SCAN
event.text: KAZAAAKPLETHKILIK DETAILS SPECIES? [Mantis] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite Stats: x2.5 combat damage, combat damage is reduced by 15% for every allied crew in the room. Inherited Stats: x0.5 repair speed, x1.2 movement speed Ability (10s cooldown): Multiplies the damage of the next attack by 20x. Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_KAZ
textList.text: "My people have forgotten codes of honor we once held so dear. In old days we live independent lives, proud lives! Now we resign selves to hunting in crowded ships of thieves, religious freaks, and suicidal tapeworms! What tragedy is this?!"

Kaz mentions the most frequent resistance he receives is that his views are simply outdated. "Who is to saying all ideas are bad because they are old? Not all change good change. And what is meaning of 'boomer mentality'?"

With Kaz busy eating in the cafeteria, you take a quick look around his room. In a small box in the corner of the room you find some... compromising pictures of the Mantis queen. You jump when you hear the door open and Kaz enter the room. "You looking at Kaz things? Oh, heheh. There are more of those if you are wanting look at them, captain."

You're curious about the stories of Kaz being an informant for the Federation during the old war. "It no secret I feel great pride for Hive, but during days of Federation-Mantis War we lose direction. I am hunter and thief captain, not soldier. Any step to end war in peaceful resolution necessary."
You find Kaz using his sword to saw off the arm of one of the dead boarders you've yet to vent from the cargo bay. You admonish him, but he does a rude dance and wiggles his sword at you.

You wonder why Kaz wields specialized swords when his claws are effectively melee weapons of their own. "Captain, have you never hearing of 'rule of cool?' Bigger sword better than claw and looking much more badass!"

Kaz claims the red paint all over his cruiser is actually blood. Nothing about that claim seems believable, but Kaz also seems like the kind of person to go to that length. Even if he wasn't - you wouldn't want to be the one to tell him you don't believe it.

Kaz tries to help you remember and pronounce his full name. "Remembering this, it is Kazaaakplethkilik. Kaz - aaak - pleth- kilik. Thinking of triple A as screams of damned as I slice throats, with k as sound of bodies hitting floor. This is part most are tripping up on. Kilik easy as well. I am killing icky things. 'Kill ick.' 'kilik.'"
Kaz prods you in the stomach. "Heh, so squishy. What it like to not have carapace? Could cut you open like water filled balloon with swipe of hand! Heheh. Not that I will. But I could."

You wonder why Kaz is known first as a thief. "Oh, I am stealing many of things. Stealing kidneys, stealing lives, stealing virginities! I am greatest of thieves!" You don't think Kaz understands what being a thief means, but at least he's proud.

It seems your autopilot is on the fritz. You tinker with the settings but it can't seem to calculate the next jump properly. You're about to give up when Kaz enters the room, fiddles with the device, punches in some numbers, and walks away. The computer beeps and corrects your route. Seems Kaz really might be smarter than your average Mantis.

Kaz complains about the Hive's use of pheromones. "We are ridiculing Free Mantis for unnatural concoctions but Hive has been doing same thing for years. Substances are less potent, yes, but addiction is still crippling. I am losing many friends to it."

"You are hopefully understanding when Rebellion defeated, Kaz must go back to hunting. If we are meeting each other again though, don't thinking I will go easy on you! I always doing better in the rematch. Heheh."

Though most of the crew are attempting to catch some sleep while they can, it seems Kaz is still wandering the ship. "Sleeping is for time when you get stabbed in back! Kaz will taking no chances, not even in this company. Fortunately, my kind can sleeping with only half of brain. This is why Kaz so dopey sometimes. Am always half asleep."

Kaz attempts to grab a plate from the dining room but drops it onto the floor. "Damn it! Stupid claws good for nothing but slicing. Engi slaves immoral my ass. More immoral leaving Mantis people suffering trying to picking damn things up!"

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SUZZY
event.text: What do you want to do with your Suzerain?

choice.text: Have your Suzerain help with upgrading the Teleporter.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SUZZY_SCAN
event.text: SUZERAIN DETAILS SPECIES? [Mantis] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite Stats: 100 Health, x2.0 combat damage, x1.5 move speed, x0.15 repair speed, x0.8 damage taken from combat Ability (17s cooldown, 7s duration): Temporarily boosts combat damage by x3.0, move speed by x3.5, and fire and suffocation damage by x4.0 Ability cooldown type: Resets on jump.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SUZZY_UPGRADE_TELE
event.text: Your Suzerain has used teleporters for many years, and knows just about everything with how to manage one. They can upgrade the system for cheaper than normal.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.

choice.text: Your Teleporter is too powerful for your Suzerain to work on them.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_SUZZY
textList.text: Your Suzerain hopes they never have to go back to one of the training compounds back in the Hive.
Your Suzerain thinks showing mercy is a sign of weakness. They also think weak people should be exterminated.
Your Suzerain thinks the crew would benefit to being exposed to a higher concentration of pheromones.
Your Suzerain thinks you should buy more bombs.
Your Suzerain hopes you will invest in more slaves. According to them, slavery is the best way to handle boring manual labor.
Your Suzerain has a great distaste for pirates. It blames them for stealing all of their potential victims.
Your Suzerain tries to convince you the benefits of cleaning yourself with the blood of your enemies.
Your Suzerain says they own no personal possessions other than their shield and armor, which they value very highly.
Your Suzerain looks forward to the oncoming fleet, and the challenge that awaits.

Your Suzerain confesses they once had a crush on the Mantis queen. If they hadn't swapped allegiances, there was even a small chance they could work their way up to being one of its mates, and even eventually be beheaded.
Your Suzerain requests that you give them control over any future boarding operations.
Your Suzerain asks if you have ever tried eating eyeballs. They promise to tear some out of the next person who boards your ship for you.
Your Suzerain recommends teaching the crew how to properly slice the enemy's jugular.
Your Suzerain confesses that joining the Federation has been a massive disappointment so far, but it's too late to return to the Hive.
Your Suzerain thinks they like you, but they haven't fully decided yet.
Your Suzerain hopes you will never back down from a fight.
Your Suzerain tells you peace is impossible, especially between stupid humans.
Your Suzerain requests that you give them a large rock to sharpen their claws on. They say even a Rockman carcass will suffice.
Your Suzerain wonders what you think of Mantis combat music. When you ask to hear it, they tell you that you must be in the middle of combat to listen. You decline.

Your Suzerain claims the Mantis's advanced intellect led to their species inventing the Repair Drone before the wheel. They also encourage you to disregard anyone who claims otherwise, and to avoid all historical documents on the Hive's ancient history.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_BISHOP
event.text: What do you want to do with your Bishop?

choice.text: Have your Bishop help with upgrading the Teleporter.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_BISHOP_SCAN
event.text: BISHOP DETAILS SPECIES? [Mantis] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Super Elite Stats: 100 Health, x2.2 combat damage, x0.07 repair speed, x0.7 damage taken from combat Ability (20s cooldown, 10s duration): Temporarily boosts combat damage to x4.3, move speed to x6.0, and fire and suffocation damage to x7.0. Cannot repair while boosted. Ability cooldown type: Continues on jump.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_BISHOP_UPGRADE_TELE
event.text: Your Bishop has used teleporters for many years, and knows just about everything with how to manage one. They can upgrade the system for cheaper than normal.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.

choice.text: Your Teleporter is too powerful for your Bishop to work on them.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_BISHOP
textList.text: Your Bishop hopes that if they die, it's from decapitation from the Queen.
Your Bishop has recently learned of the human tradition of "body pillows" and seeks to obtain one of Queen Leikonpliiinakra.
Your Bishop once tried the synthetic Free Mantis pheromones, but found the taste to be far worse than organic ones.
Your Bishop can never take off their armor, not so much because of their culture, but because they don't know how.
Your Bishop sometimes imagines epic battle music playing in the background when in combat. He recommends you do too, it really enhances the experience.
Your Bishop brags that it takes them an entire 24 minutes to repair 8 system bars. You aren't sure why thats a good thing to them, but who are you to take away this "accomplishment"?
Your Bishop misses the cocoon days when there wasn't so much responsibility, like defending the Mantis Queen, or saving reality.
Your Bishop has begun to understand drone tech a little better after spending so much time with the Engi slaves.
Your Bishop offers to teach you the Mantis Haka sometime when your lives aren't in constant danger.
Your Bishop is busy cleaning off of some equipment with their acidic spit. You hope that equipment isn't important.
Your Bishop is looking over some drawings for a prototype screwdriver able to held by a Mantis. It doesn't seem too practical.
Your Bishop is busy running laps across the ship. They pass by you 3 times in the entire time it takes you to walk from one end of the room to the other.

Your Bishop has prepared a traditional Mantis dish of flambéed Equinoid brains with a side of grilled Spider legs. You don't know where the ingredients came from, and you aren't eager to taste the dish.
Your Bishop wonders why no one has ever tried installing 2 Teleporters on the same ship to circumvent the cooldown.
Your Bishop has stuck a large picture of Queen Leikonpliiinakra on their wall. Watching them on the cameras, you see them sitting there observing it for hours upon end.
Your Bishop is jealous of the famed Mantis pirate Kazaaakplethkilik. Rumor has it, the lucky bastard is in line to be Leikonpliiinakra's next mate.
Your Bishop has begun a collection of teeth from various creatures they have killed. You hope yours never end up among that collection.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ROCK
event.text: What do you want to do with your Rockman?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ROCK_SCAN
event.text: ROCK DETAILS SPECIES? [Rockman] SUBTYPE? [No] Subtype Details: Genetic, Standard Stats: 175 Health, x0.5 move speed. Immune to fire damage, 50% stun resistance.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_ROCK
textList.text: Your Rock does not appreciate the lack of holy texts aboard your ship, but he will let you live. For now.
Your Rockman disapproves of the Rock Elder's teachings and practices, but at the very least he was welcomed there. Now, his only home is aboard this ship.
Your Rock encourages you to invest into missile technology.
Your Rockman is excited to punch some Rebels in the face.
Your Rockman makes a passing comment about how soft the human skull is.
Your Rockman admits that he is homesick, but he doesn't miss the oppression in the Rock Homeworlds.
You realize how little you know about your Rockman's home life, but they refuse to talk about it.
You Rock is surprisingly loyal to the Federation's cause. He promises he will do all in his power to ensure your victory, or die fighting for it.
Your Rock has nothing to talk about.
Your Rock cracks a bad joke, and looks expectantly at you. You squeeze out a chuckle, and they seem satisfied.
Your Rock has always wanted to fight side by side with a Mantis warrior.
You ask your Rockman about life in the Rock Homeworlds, but he refuses to talk about it.
You catch your Rockman trying to squeeze its way into its private quarters. It requests that you help push it through.
Your Rock tells you an ancient tale of a long forgotten race of cubical creatures whose name cannot be pronounced.
Your Rock wonders what it's like being a Zoltan. He hopes you will visit more Zoltan sectors in your mission.
Your Rock expresses a hatred of Anti-Personnel drones.
Your Rock has tried his best to live a sin-free life, but ever since he joined the Federation, it has become impossible for him to return to the Rock church.
Your Rock knew some close friends of his who lived a pirate's life, and once he was almost drawn in. He confesses that he prefers life in the Federation.
Your Rock appears to be caressing a small stone. He refuses to let you near it.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_OUTCAST
event.text: What do you want to do with your Rockman?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_OUTCAST_SCAN
event.text: OUTCAST DETAILS SPECIES? [Rockman] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard Stats: 160 Health, Learns combat 25% faster. Gains 5% damage for each nearby Rockmen present, and 10% for each nearby allied Outcast. Inherited Stats: x0.5 move speed. Immune to fire damage, 50% stun resistance.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_OUTCAST
textList.text: Your Outcast does not condone the merciless killings of the Rock Inquisition. His proposed solution involves a considerable amount of merciless killing.
Your Outcast explains that when they were banished from Rock territory, they were presented with only two options. Become a pirate, or rejoin society and be a coward. They chose the cool option.
Your Outcast refuses to talk about the supposed crimes that he committed that were met with their banishment.
Your Outcast confides in you that they accidentally used paint that won't wash off. Now, they just have to live with it.
Sometimes your Outcast wonders if strapping fire bombs to their chest is a good idea.
Your Outcast hopes the Federation has a more honourable court of law that doesn't involve firing squads and torture dungeons.
Your Outcast wonders if joining your crew was any better than what one of the pirate clans could offer.
Your Outcast has a deep-seeded resentment for their own species that started long before they were banished.
You catch your Outcast carrying an unusually high amount of explosives around. You advise them to stay away from important rooms.
Your Outcast suggests applying a fresh coat of pirate paint to the exterior of the ship.
Your Outcast wonders how fugitives are treated in the Federation. They can't seem to grasp the concept that the Federation does not give out death sentences for small misdemeanours.
Your Outcast complains about the paint on their face constantly running into their eye.
Your Outcast requests that you install more Mine Launchers on the ship. It's a suggestion that's painful to even listen to.
Your Outcast wishes they had a bladed weapon of some sort, as they find punching people a rather bland form of melee combat.
Your Outcast advises making sure you're always on-top of the missile supplies.
You can't find your Outcast. You ask around and hear that they're busy having an existential crisis in their quarters.
Your Outcast considers painting themselves camouflage next, but wonders what colors would work best for space camo.
Your Outcast grows tired of being so slow, and envies the races who don't take hours to walk between rooms.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_TUCO
event.text: What do you want to do with Tuco?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_TUCO_SCAN
event.text: OUTCAST DETAILS SPECIES? [Rockman] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard Stats: Learns combat 25% faster. Gains 5% damage for each nearby Rockmen present, and 10% for each nearby allied Outcast. Inherited Stats: 175 Health, x0.5 move speed. Immune to fire damage, 50% stun resistance.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_TUCO
textList.text: You find Tuco's nailed a picture of an Aquarian to his wall, where he's begun to use it as target practice. "That's my dumbass boss, Ocym. For the founder of Argeonn he's barely functional. If it wasn't for that serpent Tiesum he keeps around, the clan would have already collapsed. Supposedly there was another founder at some point, but no one knows what happened to him."

You do a once over of the cargo bay and find a hidden stash of booze stuffed in one of the vents. The question in your mind isn't who's responsible, but rather how Tuco keeps managing to sneak this aboard.

"The Theocracy banned gambling because people were wasting all of their money in casinos rather than in the church. I'd be damned if I had to give one more undeserved cent to those robed, preaching megalomaniacs when I could be playing slots and having a good time."

You're surprised to see Tuco still has a small blue shard around a necklace hanging in his room. These are traditionally religious symbols for Chrysolism, but Tuco explains it was a gift from his grandmother. "That old bat was cuckoo but she hated the Elders so much, even the Lost Suns would have been terrified of her. Incredible woman. I'm honored to carry anything of hers."
You warn Tuco about drinking so much. Having a hangover while in the middle of combat tends not to go over so well. Yet, the Rockman refuses. He'd rather die drunk than have to face reality.

You find Tuco asleep at his station. You try to wake him but he doesn't budge. You're about to diagnose him as dead when he startles awake, swatting you so hard you collide with the wall, and screaming bloody murder about 'rodents of unusual size'.

Whenever Tuco isn't having an alcoholic episode, he likes to pass time by telling the crew stories of former pirates who share his title. Sometimes it gets awfully confusing, trying to remember the difference between the several dozen Tucos whose stories he moves through seamlessly.
Tuco misses his days living within the Badlands. Though the outcasts don't mingle with outsiders much, there's tremendous cooperation within the various clans, both nomadic and settled.
"I still can hardly believe those bastards kicked me out of Sky-Drifter. You have one drunken rampage and suddenly you aren't allowed on the premises! Pansies."
You find Tuco trying on different outfits, trying to find one that's more threatening. It seems he's kind of lost focus though, because currently he's wearing a dress and tiara.

"Hahah. You wanna know something funny? Now, I learned this during my stay in the Badlands. Elder Stonewall, one of the most feared men in all the Theocracy, is really named Kaora! HAHAHAHAHAH!" You aren't really sure what's so funny about that name, but Tuco is laughing so hard he can barely stand.

You ask Tuco why he's chosen to paint himself yellow unlike the pink of normal Outcasts. "What? What kind of stupid question is what? I do it because I like yellow. Did you really expect something deeper?"

Tuco laments the day the Paladins descended on the Vrachos IV protestors. Not because of the tragic death of hundreds, or because of his own arrest, but because he should have punched those assholes in the face rather than let himself be exiled.

Tuco's never once considered working with the Lost Suns. "I don't believe Ariadne has malicious intent, but I don't think her vision is practical either. Too many people are vying for control of the Theocracy, the vision of an independent democracy is anything but secure. Whatever happens, I'm never going back. I have all the booze I want and NOBODY is going to take it away from me."
Tuco tries to teach your crew how to play the classic Rock gambling and drinking game. This isn't going to over well tomorrow, but there's no point arguing with Tuco when he's drunk.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ARIADNE
event.text: What do you want to do with Ariadne?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ARIADNE_SCAN
event.text: OUTCAST DETAILS SPECIES? [Rockman] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard Stats: Puts out fires 65% faster. Inherited Stats: 175 Health, x0.5 move speed. Immune to fire damage, 50% stun resistance. Aura: Removes fire immunities from nearby enemy crew and increases their fire vulnerability by 30%. Ability (1s cooldown, 3 charges): Starts a fire in the current room. Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump, recovers all charges.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_ARIADNE
textList.text: "Funny, whenever the Elders come into question, it's always Stonewall or Toarde. What of the other three? Murvara runs the incredibly cruel prison systems, Rutha is responsible for all the worst propaganda employed by the Theocracy, and Pretore... uh... I actually don't really know what Pretore does. I think he's in charge of waste management?"

You question Ariadne why all of the Lost Suns wear hats. "Clothing in Rock culture is traditionally a symbol of wealth, manufacturing apparel that can cover our bulk is expensive. Our hats are a symbol of defiance to this - while not so elaborate that we could be mistaken as priests."

You find a torn piece of cloth in Ariadne's room, singed at the corners and clearly torn off of a larger piece of apparel. "That was a part of my wedding dress, for when I was meant to be Toarde's bride. In commemoration of the occasion, I tore it to pieces and set it on fire. This is all that's left. I keep it around in case of some dire emergency where I forget how much I hate the Elders."

You ask Ariadne if arranged marriages are frequent in the Theocracy. "Only amongst priests and royalty. In such families, individuality matters less than dirt. If you're male, you get sent off to be a Crusader, like my brother. If you're female, you get forced into marriage. That isn't to say the poor are free either. The church has to approve before marriage can become official."

Ariadne's quarters are decorated by a number of trophies, various ornaments, weapons, and robes. The faint red splashes of dried bloodstains and what appears to be battle damage suggests these items all once belonged to different people. It doesn't take a genius to guess what happened to them, though.

For a revolutionary leader, Ariadne doesn't seem terribly talkative about the Lost Suns. Sure, she frequently takes every chance she can to talk trash about the Elders, but according to her the Lost Suns aren't "something worth bragging over." She claims they aren't a movement - they're the manifestation of the natural rights that which they have all been robbed. You suspect she just doesn't like being called a Rebel in this climate. Who would?

You find Ariadne busy in her room, pacing in front of a massive star-map that covers most of the floor. Several pieces, random assortments of objects from around the ship, have been placed like chess tokens, and holographic annotations have been hastily scribbled everywhere. Seems, even aboard your ship, her constant obsessive planning never ceases.

You notice Ariadne rarely ever eats with the rest of the crew, instead taking very small portions, just enough to maintain her current body weight. Along with that, she never accepts gifts from other crew members, never asks to borrow anything, and always leaves her stations in the same condition as she found them. Either she has some more issues than she's letting on, or just feels immense guilt for her past life as a princess. Or, probably both.

"Some say the Lost Suns are a cult. Ironic, considering we fight so hard against poisonous spiritual beliefs. If we were a cult, we'd sacrifice those who insult us in some kind of ritual. But we aren't, so I usually settle for burning them alive. No need to be eccentric."

Sometimes Ariadne can be... very extreme, but you have to admire the purpose of her mission and her dedication towards it. Though, you'll probably have to work with her on all of those public executions. The Federation would be more graceful if she wasn't going genocidal against the clergy.

Ariadne laments the way in which Chrysolism has spread to other species like the Orchids and Leeches. "It's incredible, a doctrine originally meant only to manipulate the Rock people, has been adopted by countless millions of innocent lives outside of the Theocracy. The Theocracy's influence is immense, and has disastrous consequences. I'm not even sure how to begin reversing all of the damage the Inquisitions have done."
Ariadne shares the story of how she once met the infamous Dread Pirate Tuco.

Ariadne doesn't speak much of her brother. Once a Crusader, he helped her escape from Toarde on the eve of her wedding. They founded the Lost Suns together, but he held true to his beliefs in Crystalline Divinity. This conflict eventually led to a schism in the movement, and after that she never saw her brother again.

You find Ariadne has started a 'small' fire in the cargo bay, where she has taken a seat and is watching the flames. You try to tell her to put it out, but she swats you away. "It's under control. There's always comfort in flames. Besides, what's the worst that can happen? We burn down half the cargo bay? Actually, now that I say it, that is pretty bad."

You ask Ariadne what her obsession is with fire. "Fire is a fact of nature, an unstoppable force that can cleanse anything if given enough to prosper. And everything it does touch, it starts anew. Hopefully I don't need to dumb down the metaphor further."

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_CULTIST
event.text: What do you want to do with your Cultist?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_CULTIST_SCAN
event.text: CULTIST DETAILS SPECIES? [Rockman] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard Inherited Stats: 175 Health, x0.5 move speed. Immune to fire damage, 50% stun resistance. Ability (30s cooldown, 12s duration): -75 Self Health, temporarily boosts move speed to x1.5, repair speed to x2.5, combat and sabotage damage to x2.5. Reduces damage from all sources by 25%, and resists mind control. Ability reqs: Minimum of 80 health Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_CULTIST
textList.text: Your Cultist pities you, but they won't explain why.
Your Cultist explains that they can never take their robe off. When you ask why, they mumble about "sprite sheets."
Your Cultist complains about their robes not being large enough. You shrug and explain that you don't exactly have any spares.
Your Cultist hopes that their robe is as fire proof as they are.
Your Cultist requests that you recruit more Crystalline crew.
Your Cultist is busy chanting something in their private quarters. It looks important, if not completely insane.
Your Cultist mumbles something about 'disappointment that they aren't in the add-on with the other cultist guys.'

Your Cultist thinks Grand Priest Vortigon has a really cool name. He spends almost 15 minutes explaining the significance behind every letter of the name before you break away to go back to commanding the ship.
Your Cultist hopes in a future life they'll be reborn as something cool, like an Orchid.
Your Cultist is busy listening to heavy metal rock music. At least you think that's what it is, because to you it sounds like someone smashing two trash-can lids together.
Your Cultist requests that, should they die, you return their robes back to the Cult of the Eternal Ember so that it may be reused again in the future.
Your Cultist thinks they contracted some sort of strange disease since they left the Cult to come with you. They complain about symptoms like 'freedom' and 'a sudden lack of depression'.
Your Cultist wonders what the other religions of the galaxy are like.
Your Cultist hopes to find fellow worshippers of the Ember somewhere else in the galaxy. Considering you had never heard of them before this, you doubt such a thing will happen.
Your Cultist wonders if Multiverse tech will help their cult expand and grow beyond the limitations of the old Crystal-Homeworlds.
Your Cultist wishes you would install more golden statues for worshipping.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_RUWEN
event.text: What do you want to do with Ruwen?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_RUWEN_SCAN
event.text: RUWEN DETAILS SPECIES? [Crystal] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Unique Stats: 150 Health, x0.7 move speed, takes 30% damage from suffocation On Death: 15 damage to enemy crew, locks down room Ability (28s cooldown, 12s duration): Locks down the room. While lockdown is active, takes 50% damage from combat and heals at 3hp/s, remove Phasing properties from enemies in the room, grants Phasing properties to allies in the room. Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_RUWEN
textList.text: You question Ruwen about his seemingly routine early morning stretches. "Well, it's no secret that cryosleep does anything but wonders to your body! Spend a couple decades in a chamber and, well... well I don't quite remember how you foreigners say it. Rigid as a wooden plank?"
You find Ruwen redoing the coat of golden paint over his body. You aren't actually sure what color of crystal Ruwen is underneath, but you're also uncertain if it's rude to ask.

Ruwen runs you through various common phrases in his language, but most are lost on you. It's almost like someone just stuck a bunch of syllables together with no rhyme or reason and called it an alien language!

You're impressed to find Ruwen tinkering with a couple devices on the ship, trying to improve their efficiency or repair damage from combat, though you'll have to get used to his foreign expletives whenever something goes wrong.
Ruwen's surprised how little Crystalline culture has evolved since he was freed from cryosleep. He supposes a century or two of complete isolation would do that to a society though.
You find Ruwen's room decorated by a number of oddities, personal reminders of his homeland. Several of them seem to be effigies of Dianesh, the empress. You don't ask him about it.

Ruwen plucks a golden shard from his arm and hands it to you. "In our tradition, this is symbolic for a wish of good health and protection. Should danger approach, you may plunge this into the throat of your enemies."

Ruwen still has so many places he wishes to visit someday. The Dynasty, for both its art and its military prowess, the Shells to witness the extent of their scientific advancement, and the Free Mantis because they talk funny.

Ruwen struggles with addressing different species properly. He once got himself into a life threatening situation after he took a Slug's advice and called a Mantis Suzerain a '5-eyed corpse humper'. "I see now why everyone warns me never to trust a Slug."

You find Ruwen carrying a box marked 'fragile' from the cargo bay into his quarters - something he brought aboard when he first joined your crew. "This, my friend, is Ryapel. It's the chemical stimulant we Crystals use to accelerate geode growth. Be very careful around it, it can cause some... unpleasant side effects to non-crystal biology."

Ruwen admires the colorful culture of the Mantis. "It's truly a shame that these insectoids are so hostile. My people do not practice any forms of dancing, and I would have loved to learn from them were it not that they would certainly harvest my organs at the first opportunity."

Ruwen shares with the crew an ancient Crystal legend of a sacred vault built within the caverns of the perilous world of Alcyrea. Though travel to Alcyrea was forbidden by the Empire, with their secret homeworlds now abandoned Ruwen wonders if someday someone might finally put the myth to the test.

It seems Ruwen is still troubled by that one time he called you an 'alien'. "I am truly, so terribly sorry. It's so unlike me, I... it just tears me up inside!" You tell him not to worry about it, but it doesn't seem to soothe him much.

Ruwen's always been one for adventure. Before his job as the ambassador he was eager to sign up to join the crew of a new settlement on the rim of the Rock-Crystal Empire. Then, you know, cryosleep happened and he woke up several centuries later.

Ruwen remarks on the incredible dramatic timing at which Renegades always seem to arrive just in time whenever something important is happening. The same thing happened to him, when his station was near destruction and the Federation Hero saved him just in time.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_DIANESH
event.text: What do you want to do with Dianesh?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_DIANESH_SCAN
event.text: RUWEN DETAILS SPECIES? [Crystal] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Unique Stats: 150 Health, x0.7 move speed, takes 30% damage from suffocation On Death: 15 damage to enemy crew, locks down room Ability (30s cooldown, 12s duration): Locks down the room. While lockdown is active, nearby allied crew abilities cool down 80% faster. Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_DIANESH
textList.text: Out of curiosity, you inquire just how the Elders scrubbed all traces of the Crystals so efficiently. Dianesh laughs. "It's a common misconception among foreigners that the Crystals and Rockmen lived closely throughout all of the Rock-Crystal Empire. Our two civilizations were spread apart by the length of several systems, and we Crystals have always been isolationists. The Elders didn't have to try very hard to chase us away because we were barely here to begin with."

Dianesh, at your request, explains why the Empire is... well, an Empire. "The adoption of the imperial title stems all the way back to the Rock-Crystal Empire. Even after the isolation of our people, we maintained and regulated a number of colonies and outer territories in what you usually refer to as dead space. It's a miracle it took you foreigners so long to find us."

"You'd be surprised to find much of the history of our people is as mysterious and lost to us as it is to you. It seems there was some kind of extinction level event in the past, something that wiped the entire origins of our people and split up our species. I can only wonder what..."

You begin to ask Dianesh another question about Crystalline history, but she stops you. "Please. Try asking me about something that isn’t history related. I have other things to say besides spouting exposition."

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_DEVORAK
event.text: What do you want to do with Devorak?

choice.text: Have Devorak convert one of your Zoltan Crew to a Devotee.
Have Devorak convert one of your Peacekeeper Crew to a Martyr.
Have Devorak rid your Monk of their religious ways.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_DEVORAK_SCAN
event.text: DEVORAK DETAILS SPECIES? [Zoltan] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Unique Stats: Does not lose skills from cloning, provides 2 power, 0.9x combat damage taken Inherited Stats: 75 Health On Death: 15 damage to enemy crew Ability (3s cooldown): Initiate self destruction, instantly killing self and triggering death effect. Also deals an additional 45 crew damage and 10s of stun, and causes all Zoltan in the room to explode as well. Ability cooldown type: Resets on jump.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_DEVORAK_CONVERT_ZOLTAN
event.text: Devorak sits down with your Zoltan crew...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_DEVORAK_CONVERT_PEACEKEEPER
event.text: Devorak sits down with your Peacekeeper crew...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_DEVORAK_CONVERT_MONK
event.text: Devorak sits down with your Monk crew...

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_DEVORAK
textList.text: You find Devorak sitting with several of the other crew, reciting tales of his war efforts. Though a majority of them are against the Federation, it's still quite entertaining.
Devorak thinks just about any situation can be solved by killing yourself and cloning afterwards. You don't think that's generally good advice.
Devorak warns that if you ever convert him into a mobile power source only, he'll kill you and throw your corpse out the airlock, then steal the ship and leave.
Devorak sometimes wishes he could go back to when he could feel things, rather than getting shot on the chest and figuring out about it an hour later.
Devorak remembers a time when he was once afraid to explode in battle. Now, it's nothing but second nature to him.
Devorak apologizes for your lack of ability to implode at will, and hopes seeing him do it doesn't cause you too much envy.
Devorak thinks all Rebels can go to hell. If siding with the Federation is what it takes for that dream to come true, and so it seems to be, then let it be so.
Devorak regrets ever having made a truce with the Rebellion. Now, he looks back at that decision wondering how he ever fell for such a stupid trick.
Devorak understands the need for crew damaging weapons, but finds it cowardly unless the killing strike is made by actual crew.
Devorak seems to have no end of war stories to share at a moment's notice.

Devorak recalls back to when he was a Peacekeeper at the Ministry. It wasn't the most glamorous job, but he does miss getting paid to kick people in the teeth. He still does, but it's for a non-profit cause.
Devorak scoffs at the Federation database entries about him, pointing out several flaws and large chunks of missing information that he would have assumed to be "obvious".
Devorak is willing to sacrifice himself in battle for the greater good, but would obviously prefer that a Clone Bay be backing him up when he does.

Devorak retells the time when a battle got so dire he suicide bombed his entire ship into a Federation Carrier, saving his entire fleet. It was only by a miracle that the portion of the ship with the Clone Bay was not too destroyed, and he was able to repeatedly clone until he was picked up once again.
Devorak tells a war story of when he once took out an entire ship of Peacekeepers in a single explosion after weakening them all with bombs.
Devorak shares a story about one time when he killed an entire Slug aquatic unit by jumping into the lake they were in and electrocuting all of them.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_VORTIGON
event.text: What do you want to do with Vortigon?

choice.text: Have Vortigon convert one of your Rock Crew.
Have Vortigon convert one of your Rock Crew.
Have Vortigon convert one of your Outcast Crew.
Have Vortigon convert one of your Commando Crew.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_VORTIGON_SCAN
event.text: VORTIGON DETAILS SPECIES? [Rockman] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Unique Stats: 300 Health, heals at 0.5hp/s while on fire. Inherited Stats: x0.5 move speed, 50% stun resistance. Ability (37s cooldown, 20s duration): Regenerate health at a rate of 65hp/s and gain 3x combat damage, but move at 0.25x speed and take 7x more damage from all sources. Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_VORTIGON_CONVERT_ROCK
event.text: Vortigon sits down with your Rock crew...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_VORTIGON_CONVERT_OUTCAST
event.text: Vortigon sits down with your Rock crew...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_VORTIGON_CONVERT_COMMANDO
event.text: Vortigon sits down with your Rock crew...

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_VORTIGON
textList.text: As you approach Vortigon, he begins to laugh menacingly. Uncertain, you back slowly out of the room and close the door behind you.
Vortigon is busy contemplating if he should change the color of his robes.
Vortigon brags about how cool his name is, and insults your 'pathetic' name. According to him, the name's length is what matters most.
Vortigon hopes that the crew of other Federation ships have more style and class than yours.
Vortigon appears to be under-way with some sort of strange ritual. As long as he isn't summoning any demons, you're ok with it.
Vortigon wonders what other lifeforms he might be able to convert into his cult now that he has left the Crystalline Homeworlds.
Vortigon makes it clear time and time again that he finds you disgusting. Why did we let this guy onto the ship?
Vortigon is busy cooking some sort of strange stew made with the blood of virgins.
Vortigon briefly mentions something about a rival cult, whose name sounds something similar to 'Mar', whose been stealing their recruits for some time. He doesn't sound very happy about it.
Vortigon never wants to see another damn teal ship ever again. Something about some 'Elder Cult', but he won't say anything more.
Vortigon hates being slow. He also hates tripping over his cloak. Come to think of it, he seems to hate a lot of things.
Vortigon wants to meet the Zoltan Minister some day. He thinks the Zoltan race would make an excellent addition to his cult.
Vortigon is busy writing another chapter for the Ember Holy Texts.
Vortigon requests that you make it mandatory for all crew members to memorize his scripture. You refuse.
Vortigon randomly quotes a verse from his holy texts, and then tries to explain the significance behind it.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_CRUSADER
event.text: What do you want to do with your Rockman Crusader?

choice.text: Have your Crusader help with upgrading the weapons.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_CRUSADER_SCAN
event.text: CRUSADER DETAILS SPECIES? [Rockman] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite Stats: 300 Health, x0.4 move speed. Takes 50% suffocation damage, is immune to stun. Inherited Stats: Immune to fire.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_CRUSADER_UPGRADE_WEAPONS
event.text: Your Crusader has training in operating and repairing weapon systems. They can upgrade the system for cheaper than normal.

choice.text: Your weapons are too weak for your Crusader to help.

event.text: Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.

choice.text: Your weapons are too powerful for your Crusader to work on them.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_CRUSADER
textList.text: Your Crusader hopes there will someday be another inquisition. They miss the action from the first one.
Your Crusader enjoys war, and the screams of heretics as their skulls are forcefully removed from their fleshy heads.
Your Crusader explains that their Crystal-colored exterior is actually the work of a daily-routine of applying paint, rather than genetic based.
Your Crusader wants to bash everything in sight. You leave as quickly as possible.
Your Crusader has a philosophical discussion with you on the differences between smashing and bashing.
Your Crusader wonders why historically the Human crusaders didn't end very well, when the Rock Inquisitions went so wonderfully.
Your Crusader has started a collection of alien skulls. You aren't sure where they came from, and you aren't eager to ask.

Your Crusader reads you their favourite passage from the Rockman Holy Texts. It's a long gruesome tale about three Human heretics who were run through with flaming spears and put on display for all of the Rock people to see.
Your Crusader advises the installation of more Missile Launchers.
Your Crusader is busy exercising using one of the other crew as a dumbbell.
Your Crusader has an extreme fear of geologists.
Your Crusader has met many a Crystal in their life-time, and the wonders of the Crystalline kind never cease to amaze them.
Your Crusader is never sure of the truth anymore, after spending so many years of their life living under the control of the Rock Elders.
Your Crusader is busy secretly trying to patch up a hole in the wall that they accidentally caused during a fit of anger. You pretend to not notice.
Your Crusader fears no man. Spiders however, are a different story.
Your Crusader believes that if the Federation simply dropped their cowardly morals and just committed some warcrimes, it would be better for everyone.
Your Crusader admits that they are not an eager supporter of the visitors from other realities.
Your Crusader wishes to someday discover whether they are sedimentary, igneous, or metamorphic.
Your Crusader hates being too large to fit through regular sized doors.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SYMBIOTE
event.text: What do you want to do with your Symbiote?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SYMBIOTE_SCAN
event.text: SYMBIOTE DETAILS SPECIES? [Uhhhhhhhhhhh] SUBTYPE? [Probably?] Subtype Details: Unique Stats: 175 Health, x0.5 move speed. Immune to fire, 85% stun resistance. Provides 1 power to the current system. On Death: 15 damage to enemy crew

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_SYMBIOTE
textList.text: Your Symbiote lives in eternal agony, but it doesn't mind.
The Rockman sometimes grows tired of the Zoltan's insistent pleas for non-violence, but it tries to respect its wishes when it can.
Your Symbiote someday wants to hunt down the Slug that caused all of this.
Your Symbiote wonders if the constant surge of power running through the Rock's body is healthy.
You find your Symbiote talking to itself. You're concerned about its mental health considering all its been through, but it explains that its actually just conversing with the Zoltan.
You ask how the Zoltan feels about the Rockman being in control of the body. The Rockman explains that's not always true, and the Zoltan sometimes uses it as a puppet.
Your Symbiote is deathly afraid of Slugs and mind control. You can't blame it.
Your Symbiote wonders if anyone has ever tried to merge Energy and Missile weapons. If they have, it recommends you buy one.
Your Symbiote finds communication with the Zoltan surprisingly easy despite being separated by a full layer of intestines.
Talking with your Symbiote is hard, as sometimes you can hear the Zoltan talking whenever the Rockman opens its mouth.
You ask whether the Symbiote wants to be referred to as one or two people. It says it doesn't mind either, as the line between the two in its mind has been blurred.
Your Symbiote hates having to constantly eat food, but the Zoltan has to eat too.
You wonder if the Rockman and Zoltan have an agreement over who gets to consume what food.
Your Symbiote hopes you'll avoid nebulas as much as possible.
Your Symbiote wonders if this was all worth it. The Rockman does enjoy generating power though.
You remark on how well the abilities of the two work together. The Symbiote agrees.
Your Symbiote is busy trying to sing a song, alternating lyrics with the Zoltan.
The Rockman is glad that it was a Zoltan it ate, and not something painful like a Lanius.
Your Rockman wonders how it will be received when it returns to the Rock Homeworlds after this mission is over.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SALT
event.text: What do you want to do with Obyn?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SALT_SCAN
event.text: SALTMAN DETAILS SPECIES? [Saltman] SUBTYPE? [No] Subtype Details: Unique Stats: 250 max health, x0.6 move speed, 70% suffocation damage. All crew in the same room heal 33% slower. Ability (20s cooldown, 15s duration): Damage all nearby crew. Enemies lose 4hp/s, friendlies lose 2hp/s, Slugs of any side lose an extra 4hp/s. Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_SALT
textList.text: Obyn misses the days when he could just freely go about melting Clansmen. Being a Federation hero has its perks, but it also means you can't just go committing warcrimes. Probably.
Obyn reflects on the missed opportunity to call his 2nd mate "pepper".
Obyn wonders if his prized Salt launchers would be considered illegal by the Federation if they find out about them. He begs you never to tell anyone.
"Ever notice how the Clansmen change their accent with nearly every bit of dialogue? It's kinda creepy..."

Obyn might be big, rough, and violent, but he has a soft spot for poetry. His latest work is simply titled "I'd rip the eyes out of a hatchling's head and eat them with chopsticks for you." How romantic?
Obyn isn't sure if he hates Rebels or Slugs more. His character arc hasn't included Rebels until this point, but it just seems like everyone hates Rebels instinctually except the Rebels themselves.
Obyn is ashamed of both the Rock and Crystalline societies. He doesn't want to get into the specifics though, because politics and such.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_COMMANDO
event.text: What do you want to do with your Rockman Commando?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_COMMANDO_SCAN
event.text: COMMANDO DETAILS SPECIES? [Rockman] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard Inherited Stats: 175 Health, x0.5 move speed. Immune to fire damage, 50% stun resistance. Ability (29s cooldown): Starts a fire in the current room. Uses 1 charge. Ability cooldown type: Refills a charge on jump. Can hold 2 charges.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_COMMANDO
textList.text: Your Commando can speak in great lengths of his hatred of the Rock Homeworlds. You eventually have to cut him off to break away and get back to piloting the ship.
Your Commando wishes you would install more fire tech on the ship. He promises it will be worth it.
Your Commando wishes you a death in the Holy Fires. You're taken aback at first, but the Commando ensures you it's a compliment.
Your Commando writes a formal complaint and hands it to you. A majority of the page describes their dissatisfaction in your abilities at piloting the ship, and tells you to dodge more often.
You notice your Commando marching around the hallways. You ask what they are doing, to which they respond by telling you that they are patrolling for intruders. You leave them to it.
As you pass by, your Commando pulls you aside to tell you that the life support needs more attention. He doesn't want to end up nearly choking to death like the last ship he served on.
Your Commando refuses to talk to you about anything other than possible combat optimizations for the ship, none of which you agree with.
Your Commando lets you know Rockmen are a superior species, but some of the other aliens are pretty neat, he supposes.
Your Commando is playing with a lighter in his quarters. You reprimand him, but he gives you a murderous glare and you leave.
Your Commando thinks the intercom needs to be louder.
Your Commando thinks you need to have a uniform for all of the crew to wear.
You compliment your Commando's hat. He scowls back.
It's difficult to make conversation with your Commando, and they make no attempt to think of anything themselves.
Your Commando informs you that the art of punching people in the face requires a very specific skillset.
Your Commando finds Zoltan science facinating. They wonder if there are any fire based Energy weapons available.
You ask if your Commando minds having to kill other Rock ships. They tell you not to worry, they've trained for years to be completely numb to killing anything in their way.
Your Commando desires to learn how to create ammunition at some point. They tell you how the Lost Suns can primarily only afford cheap, poorly made ammunition.
Your Commando tells you that if you ever make it out of this mission alive, he will look into being a guard for hire for Federation officials.
Your Commando makes a sarcastic comment on the glory of the Rock Elders. You decide not to incite any further conversation from them.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SHELL
event.text: What do you want to do with your Shell?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SHELL_SCAN
