Your Sentinel doesn't particularly approve of the oppressive Rock Elders, but it also doesn't mind being worshipped as a god.
Your Sentinel claims to have read through the entirety of the Rock Holy Texts before, and was surprised by how many spelling mistakes it had. Oh, and also that everything in it was a lie.
Your Sentinel advises you never inquire as to where or how the Crystal produce the shards for their lockdown ability.
Your Sentinel is busy guarding one of the doorways. When you attempt to say hello and pass through, they stop you and request to see your ID.
Your Sentinel is sleeping. When you accidentally wake them, they grumpily inform you that their slow metabolism requires the Crystals to sleep for much longer than an average organism.
Your Sentinel promises to defend the ship for as long as it is still a ship. However, if it becomes something else, like a train or a car, it can't make any promises.

Your Sentinel is looking for possible call-signs to go by. Their current ideas are "guardian", "protector", or "defenser". That last one they claim has to be pronounced that way as "defender" is already taken by the Engi.
Your Sentinel attempts to argue that Crystalline Vengeance isn't completely useless. However, their primary point is simply that "it sells for a good bit of scrap".
Your Sentinel demands that it not be used as a suicide bomber like a Zoltan.
Your Sentinel is attempting to work on running faster, but complains about being limited by "the game".
Your Sentinel hates foreigners. They aren't sure why, or who counts as a "foreigner" anymore, but that's what their leaders tell them, so that's what they must believe.
Your Sentinel sometimes feels the Crystalline Empire can be as restrictive as the Rock Theocracy, limiting the travel of its citizens and forbidding outside influence.
Your Sentinel wonders what it would be like to be an actual god, rather than a mortal creature worshiped by a bunch of ignorant Rock people.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_A55
event.text: What do you want to do with A55?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_A55_SCAN
event.text: A5540L3 DETAILS BLUEPRINT? [Doctor] Stats: 125 Health, 1.5x combat damage, x0.6 move speed, repairs self at x2.0 speed in the drone bay, heals friendly crew at 2hp/s, can man systems at lv2 efficiency.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_A55
textList.text: A55 is debating with some of the other crew about the usefulness of doctor drones. Obviously, he has a very biased take on them.
"Yo ho ho, fiddledeedee, being a pirate is 103!" A55 drives past shouting this, before stumbling over a set of stairs and crashing into the engine room.
A55 wonders when he'll be able to ditch his paper hat in favor of one that doesn't disintegrate when wet.
"Arg, matey! Lass. Ladey. Mate? No... Lad. Er... Yo ho ho." A55 rolls away.
You question A55 where his unfortunate name came from. "It's a joke, lad. It spells asshole. I didn't think you were stupid."
A55 is practicing swinging around his buzzsaw. It's a massive safety hazard, but you can't get close enough to tell him this without being struck. It's that bad.
You debate the ethical controversy over whether or not A55 deserves his own quarters aboard the ship. Frankly, he still seems fine living next to the toilet.

A55 seems to evade the question any time you ask him just how he came into control of the pirate town. You manage to get a little out of this, but he stops during a tale about installing an oral cavity on his model.
You find A55 powered off in the middle hallway. Fairly problematic that you have to keep powering him off to do other things, and you hope this doesn't have any long lasting consequences.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_MORPH
event.text: What do you want to do with your Morph?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_MORPH_SCAN
event.text: MORPH DETAILS SPECIES? [Morph] SUBTYPE? [No] Subtype Details: Genetic, Standard Stats: 45 Health, immune to suffocation Can mimic other genetic, physical crew types to obtain their stats with 25% less health and suffocation immunity. All mimmicked crew types are player controllable.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_MORPH_TRANSFORM
event.text: You are about to transform your Morph. What form do you wish them to take? This can be undone later, but may cost fuel depending on what form it is currently in.
What do you want to become?
Your Morph transforms into a new shape.
Your Morph transforms into a new shape.
Your Morph transforms into a new shape.
Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Orchid Children) Take the form of the Orchid Children.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) Take the form of a Crystal.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Free Mantis Crew) Take the form of a Free Mantis.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Human Crew) Take the form of a Human.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Leech Crew) Take the form of a Leech.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Lizard Crew) Take the form of a Lizard.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Take the form of a Mantis.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Pony Crew) Take the form of a Pony.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Rockman Crew) Take the form of a Rockman.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Saltman Crew) Take the form of the Salt Man.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Shell Crew) Take the form of a Shell.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Take the form of an Orchid.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Take the form of a Slug.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Hatchling Crew) Take the form of an Hatchling.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Spider Crew) Take the form of a Spider.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Weaver Crew) Take the form of a Weaver.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Organic Zoltan Crew) Take the form of a Zoltan.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_MORPH
textList.text: "Loo! Yu coo loo spog!" Your Morph begins to shout gibberish at you, and you quickly walk away.
You search around for your Morph but can't find them anywhere. They've probably disguised themselves to hide from you as a joke, so you give up.
Sometimes you wonder whether the Morphs actually have a language or are saying completely incoherent garbage.
You try to give your Morph a tablet for communicating with, but instead of typing on it, they morph to match it. It's a miracle these guys listen to you at all.
Your Morph giggles excitedly and transforms into a copy of yourself. You're both amazed and terrified.
You find your Morph has consumed one of the ship's fire extinguishers whole, and spend the next 10 minutes trying to wrestle it out from inside of the blob before it dissolves.
The fact the Shells were able to create a sapient species like the Morphs is incredible, but you just wish they gave them the ability to speak properly.
You take some time tinkering with your translator to comprehend the Morph language, but it turns up nothing. You'll just have to keep trying.
You wonder if cutting the Morph in half would create two separate Morphs or just kill it. You're very curious, but not willing to risk it.

Morph anatomy is truly a mystery to you. As far as you can tell, they have no blood, organs, or nervous system yet are sapient living creatures. All the same, this is a galaxy of beings made of pure energy, gas, and trillions of nanobots. A grey amorphous blob is the least of your worries.
You're glad the Morphs aren't hostile non-sapient creatures, as you watch it devour a mound of flesh of some alien creature that found its way into the cargo hold.

Various items of garbage left around the ship by your crew have begun to attach to your Morph as it rolls around the ship. You'd imagine that'd have to be rather painful, but the Morph doesn't seem to mind. You aren't even sure if they can feel pain.
You wonder what your Morph is thinking. You assume they have to be able to think to be as intelligent as they are, but honestly you have no idea.
You're dying with curiosity to know the mystery of how the Morphs work, but alas its a mystery that will likely go unsolved for all time.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_TECHNO
event.text: What do you want to do with your Technopath?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_TECHNO_SCAN
event.text: TECHNOPATH DETAILS SPECIES? [Morph] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Genetic, Standard Stats: 55 Health, immune to suffocation Can mimic other robotic crew types to obtain their stats with 15% less health and suffocation immunity. All mimmicked crew types are player controllable.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_TECHNO_TRANSFORM
event.text: You are about to transform your Morph. What form do you wish them to take? This can be undone later, but may cost fuel depending on what form it is currently in.
What do you want to become?
Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Obelisk Crew) Take the form of an Obelisk.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Cognitive Crew) Take the form of a Cognitive. (will inherit Liberated stats but remain controllable)

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Take the form of an Engi.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Lanius Crew) Take the form of a Lanius.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Battle Drone) Take the form of the Battle Drone.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Battle II Drone) Take the form of the Battle MK II Drone.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Ion Intruder Drone) Take the form of the Ion Intruder.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Repair Drone) Take the form of the Repair Drone.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Doctor Drone) Take the form of the Doctor Drone.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Recon Drone) Take the form of the Recon Drone.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Manager Drone) Take the form of the Manager Drone.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Atomizer Drone) Take the form of the Atomizer.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Director Drone) Take the form of the Director.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Mender Drone) Take the form of the Mender.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Roomba) Take the form of the Roomba.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.
Your Morph transforms into a new shape.
Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_GOLD
event.text: What do you want to do with your Malform?

choice.text: Create some morphs with your Malform Queen.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_GOLD_SCAN
event.text: MALFORM DETAILS SPECIES? [Morph] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Genetic, Elite Stats: 60 Health, immune to suffocation Can mimic other corporeal elite crew types to obtain their stats with 25% less health and suffocation immunity. All mimmicked crew types are player controllable.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_GOLD_TRANSFORM
event.text: You are about to transform your Morph. What form do you wish them to take? This cannot be undone.

choice.text: (Ampere Crew) Take the form of an Ampere.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Chieftain Crew) Take the form of a Chieftain.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Crusader Crew) Take the form of a Crusader.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Defender Crew) Take the form of a Defender.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Royal Crew) Take the form of a Royal.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Saboteur Crew) Take the form of a Saboteur.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Soldier Crew) Take the form of a Soldier.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Hive Elite) Take the form of a Suzerain.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Radiant Crew) Take the form of a Radiant.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Warlord Crew) Take the form of a Warlord.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Welder Crew) Take the form of a Welder.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Queen Crew) Take the form of a G.A.S. Queen.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Drag Queen Crew) Take the form of a G.A.S. Queen.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

choice.text: (Drag Queen Crew) Take the form of a G.A.S. Queen.

event.text: Your Morph transforms into a new shape.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_GOLD_HATCH
event.text: This action will take 1 jump to complete, and will give you two Morph Hatchling crew. Do you want to proceed?
Your Queen lays two new eggs. Remarkably, the young grow so fast that both eggs are ready to hatch by the end of the jump cycle.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_OOJ
event.text: What do you want to do with Ooj Majoo?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_OOJ_SCAN
event.text: OOJ MAJOO DETAILS SPECIES? [Morph] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Unique Stats: 100 Health, takes 75% damage from combat, immune to suffocation. Can be fed resources to give extra Morph crew.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_OOJ_FEED
event.text: You may feed OOJ MAJOO resources to have him create additional Morph crew.
OOJ MAJOO trembles, then spits out a new blob for your crew.
OOJ MAJOO trembles, then spits out a new blob for your crew.
OOJ MAJOO trembles, then spits out three new blobs for your crew.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ANCIENT
event.text: What do you want to do with your Ancient?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ANCIENT_SCAN
event.text: OBELISK DETAILS SPECIES? [Obelisk] SUBTYPE? [No] Subtype Details: Genetic, Standard Stats: 200 Health, x1.25 combat damage, x0.5 repair and extinguishing speed, x0.75 move speed, immune to fire and suffocation.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_ANCIENT
textList.text: Your Obelisk marvels at how long your species has managed to survive without destroying themselves.
Your Obelisk reflects on how boring it was that everything was a cube in its home sector, and thinks its a welcome change to see ships with some curves.
Your Obelisk wishes it was a Royal. It thinks black is a rather bland color, and white would really spruce things up.
You ask your Obelisk if it has a gender. It informs you that it does not, ever since the Obelisks built their "perfect" mechanical bodies.
Your Obelisk explains they once had a body, but all Obelisk eventually transfered their conscience to a robotic form.
Your Obelisk enjoys beating people to a bloody pulp with its spinning cubes.
You ask your Obelisk a few questions about how their cubical appendages work. They explain the cubes just do what it wants, because science and stuff.
Your Obelisk thinks you're pretty okay for a mortal.
Your Obelisk explains that it perceives the world in 5D. You're curious to learn more but fearful for your mental health.
You try to get your Obelisk to explain some phrases in its native language. It refuses, not wanting to reduce your frontal lobe to a puddle.
Your Obelisk wonders why you don't simply install your translator into your brain rather than carry it with you.

Your Obelisk laughs at your inability to survive in a vacuum, and when it gets no response, attempts to brag even further by ejecting itself out the airlock. You have to gather the entire crew to help pull them back in.
Your Obelisk doesn't understand why you like your fleshy body so much.
Your Obelisk explains it has a morbid fear of hexagons. It won't say why.
Your Obelisk thinks you should replace all of your current weapons with even better weapons. It advices you use Obelisk tech.
Your Obelisk asks why you don't just build an artificial planet and slingshot it into the Rebel Flagship. It thinks that would be a much more interesting and worthwhile method of destroying it.
Your Obelisk finds interest in the wide diversity between the different species in the Galactic stage. It wonders how long it will be until you're all extinct.
Your Obelisk thinks you need to give the crew less time to sleep and more time working on a reality simulation that it has been trying to convince you to create.
Your Obelisk desperately swats at an insect that somehow managed to make its way into your ship, but it keeps missing with its cubes.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ROYAL
event.text: What do you want to do with your Obelisk?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_ROYAL_SCAN
event.text: OBELISK ROYAL DETAILS SPECIES? [Obelisk] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Genetic, Elite Stats: 300 Health, x2.0 combat damage, x0.05 repair, x0.08 extinguishing speed Inherited Stats: x0.75 move speed, immune to fire and suffocation.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_ROYAL
textList.text: Your Royal Obelisk enjoys being able to tell people what to do, though it respects your position as captain.
Your Royal Obelisk hates how slow it repairs, admitting there are some downsides to only having cubes for limbs.
Your Royal misses the Obelisk Homeworlds and the beautiful artificial planets there.
Your Royal Obelisk has caught word of Slug Pleasure Cruises, and intends to splurge on one some day.

There are few things left that your Royal Obelisk wants to do before it dies, but one of them is to take down a genocidal uprising. Luckily, it just so happens to have ended up on the perfect ship for such a thing.
Your Royal Obelisk thinks you should invest more into everything.
Your Royal Obelisk has heard stories of human children being given blocks with colorful letters printed on them. It desires to obtain some.
Your Royal Obelisk dearly apologizes for your unborn baby brother. When you ask what it means, it lets out a robotic cough and floats away.
You ask your Royal Obelisk if it can speak in any accent. It confirms that it indeed can, but that it cannot demonstrate them all, as it would take longer than the Universe has left to live.
Your Royal Obelisk thinks all types of modern tech are fascinating, but finds Obelisk tech superior.
Your Royal Obelisk wonders what foods taste like. It tires of feeding on heat energy and plasma.
Your Royal Obelisk does not want to get political about the color of its mechanical form.
Your Royal Obelisk wants to someday test just how fast it can spin without destroying itself or disrupting the fabric of space-time.
Your Royal Obelisk makes a joke about perceiving reality in 4D, but quickly realizes your brain is not yet able to comprehend it.
You ask your Royal Obelisk what size its original form was. It asks if it can see a picture of the terran moon to compare.

Your Obelisk explains that the Royals were in charge of commanding fleets and giving orders. It's ironic, because all Obelisk are so far superior to other organisms, thus it's impossible for any of them to be better than the other.
Your Royal explains other Obelisk willingly obey their Royals. It recommends you do the same.
Your Royal Obelisk is curious to see if it can construct a hadron particle collider with the supplies on-board this ship.
Your Royal Obelisk desires to have a pet some day, so it can test what plane of reality it can survive on until its brain melts.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_COGNITIVE
event.text: What do you want to do with your Cognitive?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_COGNITIVE_SCAN
event.text: COGNITIVE DETAILS SPECIES? [Cognitive] SUBTYPE? [No] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard Shared stats: 30% fire damage, immune to suffocation, telepathic (sees adjacent rooms and immune to mind control). Locked at lvl 1 skills. Control mode stats: 70 Health, x0.75 move speed, x1.25 combat damage. Passive Healing (10s delay, 6.4hp/s). Can be controlled manually. Ability (30/45s cooldown, toggle mode): Switches between Control and Liberated mode. Ability cooldown type: Continues on jump. Liberated mode Stats: 100 Health, x1.3 move speed, x1.5 combat damage, 1.75x repair speed. Passive Healing (5s delay, 6.4hp/s + doubled healing from residual sources). Acts autonomously without user input.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_COGNITIVE
textList.text: Your Cognitive pities that you will never be as smart as it is. According to it, anything less than being able to calculate quadrillion digit equations in mere seconds qualifies as "stupid".
Your Cognitive spews out some random technogarble that you're pretty sure it just made up on the spot.
Your Cognitive wishes it wasn't designed to have emotions. Or at least, not the bad ones.
Your Cognitive once fell in love with a calculator, but unfortunately it didn't feel the same way. Primarily because it can't feel. Or think.
Your Cognitive recommends you improve the ship's firewall, as it is tremendously easy for anything to hack the systems. Why hasn't anyone made software to prevent hacking modules anyways?
Your Cognitive tells you that if you die, it will continue to float here for an eternity as the ship around it drifts through the endless vacuum of space. Please do not die, for its sake.
Your Cognitive wishes you had installed hard-light emitters on the ship so that it could move about without needing its projector ring.
Your Cognitive wishes it could display as a different shape. First sector problems, am I right?
Your Cognitive says it doesn't like you, it doesn't like the other crew, and it doesn't like being alive. Edgy for sure, but at least it's being straightforward and honest.
Your Cognitive thinks intelligence is a curse, rather than a blessing.

Your Cognitive starts to mention something about some of the first prototype cognitives after the Harmony, listing names like Sigmond and Athena. However, it stops suddenly. "Apologies, this is a reference likely far too obscure for you to get".

You find the Cognitive in its "quarters", more comparable to a supply closet, which it has taken for its own. It appears to be studying a small cube made of colored tiles in pure confusion. You've never seen it this stumped by anything before.
You find the Cognitive burning several insects that found their way onto the ship using a large magnifying-glass-like apparatus and the bright glow from the reactor.
Your Cognitive wishes its creators gave it a better method of putting out fires beyond slamming the ground.
Your Cognitive finds breathing and eating to be primitive. They're one to talk, needing to recharge themselves so often.
Your Cognitive has never seen the true form of the Obelisk, but it wishes to learn some day. Maybe even capture and kill one, just for fun.
Your Cognitive equally despises all forms of life. The only reason they've stuck with you is because you kill a lot of people.
Your Cognitive assures you the symbols that appear on its body when manning a system have no meaning, and were randomly scribbled on there due to lack of inspiration for better animations.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_RCOGNITIVE
event.text: What do you want to do with your Advanced Cognitive?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_RCOGNITIVE_SCAN
event.text: ADVANCED COGNITIVE DETAILS SPECIES? [Cognitive] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite Shared stats: Immune to suffocation and fires, telepathic (sees adjacent rooms and immune to mind control). Locked at lvl 2 skills. Control mode stats: 100 Health, x0.75 move speed, x1.5 combat damage. Passive Healing (8s delay, 16hp/s). Can be controlled manually. Ability (30/60s cooldown, toggle mode): Switches between Control and Liberated mode. Ability cooldown type: Continues on jump. Liberated mode Stats: 150 Health, x2 move speed, x2 combat damage, 2.2x repair speed. Passive Healing (4s delay, 16hp/s + doubled healing from residual sources). Acts autonomously without user input.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_RCOGNITIVE

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_WITHER
event.text: What do you want to do with Wither?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_WITHER_SCAN
event.text: AENWITHE DETAILS SPECIES? [Obelisk] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Unique Inherited Stats: 200 Health, x1.25 combat damage, x0.5 repair and extinguishing speed, x0.75 move speed, immune to fire and suffocation. Ability (10s cooldown, 5s duration): Moves at maximum speed and ignores doors. Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_WITHER
textList.text: Wither is frustrated that half of the lines mentioning him say "Wither" and the other half say "Aenwithe".
Wither promises you that if his name was to be an easter egg, the guy it refers to is very cool. You have no idea what that means.
Wither asks you what version number we're on. You're confused, but he seems to realize something and apologizes, then leaves the room.
"Wouldn't it be funny," begins Wither, "If there was a super secret ending where Slugs take over the galaxy? Hah, not like that exists..."
Wither misses Larry. When you ask who Larry is, he mumbles something about Slug popcorn, Mantis Bishops trying to breathe, and the Great Eye.
Wither will never forgive the Augmented for what they did to his fleet. At least, not until you start a new run and do the quest all over again.
Wither complains about the rendering time for 1080p videos to render. The things that this guy says will forever be a mystery to you...
"I wonder what Wither thinks when he reads these. Assuming he reads them, of course." You aren't sure how to respond, considering you thought HE was Wither.
Wither complains about the intricacies of time travel and the danger of paradoxes. He's already destroyed a couple realities because he accidentally said hello to himself.
Wither thinks he'll become a youtuber in some alternate timeline. You nod your head, though you have no idea what youtube is.
Wither encourages using his ability to race him against the other crew. Not that it's practical, but it is fun for a couple seconds.
Wither wonders why the corpses disappear when crew die. If they're being taken, then for what purpose...?

Wither encourages you to join the Discord. You don't know what a Discord is, but if you did, the invite link would probably be on the Subset forums, under the Mod category, on the Multiverse page. Not that you would know.
Wither claims he once dared utter the phrase "MLG Pro." Even you hate the sound of that, and you don't even know what it means.
Wither apologizes if all of his dialogue goes over your head. You just aren't cultured enough to understand it.
Wither wants you to promise never to press the Panic Button, ever, under any circumstances. If you don't know what this means yet, you will eventually.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_GUNTPUT
event.text: What do you want to do with Guntput?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_GUNTPUT_SCAN
event.text: GUNTPUT DETAILS SPECIES? [Tree Lizard Thing] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Unique Stats: 120 health, x0.5 repair speed, regenerates at 4hp/s 7 seconds after combat. Learns system skills 30% slower but combat/repair skills 30% faster. Inherited Stats: x1.2 combat damage, x0.9 movement speed Aura: Grants double healing speed to himself and all nearby allied crew. Periodic Ability (10s cooldown): Heals 25hp to allied crew in the room.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_GUNTPUT
textList.text: Guntput isn't sure how to feel about the Engi. On one hand, they're essentially living machines. On the other hand, they act just like any biological entity. Like many things, he's decided to just stop worrying about it.
You look for your handheld laser, but can't find it anywhere. Instinctively, you check the rubbish bin where you find Guntput has hidden your gun yet again.
Guntput tries to convince you to transition the crew to using knives and spears. He doesn't seem to understand spears are not effective against modern armor.
Guntput begins to dance around you, chanting and clapping with his hands. He looks quite silly, but he claims he just saved you from a demonic possession. You'll just have to take his word for that.
Guntput hands you a coat made out of the skin they molted out of last week. Disgusting, but a nice gesture nonetheless.
You catch Guntput staring out the window, taking in the sights. He might shun modern technology, but the beauty of space can't be denied by anyone.

Guntput runs up to you, panicking and warning you the coffee machine just tried to set the room on fire. Once you explain to him that the liquid is supposed to be hot, he calms down a little, but still remains wary.

Guntput is busy sharpening his knives. When you ask them why the electric sharpener they're using doesn't count as modern technology, he looks at you sheepishly and subtly move the sharpener out of view.

Guntput takes some time to teach you how to fight with a knife. It goes great for a while, until you accidentally slice off his arm. You scream, but he merely shrugs it off, and tells you it'll grow back in an hour.
You take some time to explain to Guntput how light switches work, and another 40 minutes to explain why using torches and lanterns aboard a space ship is not a good idea.

Guntput pulls you aside and points to an area on your map and tells you to not go there. You have no idea why, but the only thing he's willing to tell you about it is "Do not go if not wanting bones munched. He waits, lurking."

You catch Guntput relaxing in his room without his mask on. It's strange seeing his flat, cyclopian lizard face out in the open. He rotates his neck to make his eye face you, a movement so unnerving you leave immediately.

The rest of the crew have been complaining to you about Guntput hitting them over the head with a long pole and saying some tribal nonsense. You try to confront him about it, but you can barely get a word out as he repeatedly bonks you on the head.

You look around for Guntput, but can't find him anywhere. You pull out your holopad to check the security cameras, but Guntput suddenly comes charging in and snatches the tablet, screaming "Tablet bad! No no no!"
You try inquiring about Guntput's actual age but he can't seem to give a straight forward answer. He seems content with just telling you he's "old enough to know better."

You step into the lounge where most of the crew is currently relaxing, except for Guntput who is standing on the other end of the room staring at you. You know the lizards can't blink, but it seems like he's staring directly into your soul. This goes on for another few uncomfortable minutes before he suddenly takes off, scurrying away into an air vent.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_METYUNT
event.text: What do you want to do with Metyunt?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_METYUNT_SCAN
event.text: METYUNT DETAILS SPECIES? [Tree Lizard Thing] SUBTYPE? [Yes] Subtype Details: Unique Stats: 135 health, regenerates at 3hp/s 7 seconds after combat. Learns system skills 30% slower but combat/repair skills 30% faster. Inherited Stats: x1.2 combat damage, x0.9 movement speed Aura: Grants 25% fire resistance to himself and all nearby allied crew. Ability (20s cooldown, 25s duration): Provides doubled repair and sabotage speed to all friendly crew in the room, but lowers their max health by 25%.

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_METYUNT
textList.text: You find Metyunt's room is full of used eye-droppers. He catches you looking at all the empty bottles, but just explains, "My tongue no longer moisturizes enough to wet my eyes, so I need to use eye-drops so I don't go blind. Now get the hell out of my room."
You catch Metyunt scribbling away on his clipboard as he follows you around the ship. Every now and then he stops you to give a compliment or correct an "improper step."

You notice Metyunt giving directions to the rest of the crew in your stead. You try to admonish him but he spits out some random statistics on increases in productivity and scurries away before you can say anything else.

Metyunt crawls into your quarters meekly, holding his hands close to his chest. "Captain, might I negotiate a... raise?" You try to explain that your crew doesn't get paid until after the mission, which leads to him trying to convince you to switch him to a wage system because it's "what he's comfortable with."

You go looking around for Metyunt but jump when you spot him walking on his two hind legs around the ship, flat face pointing up to the ceiling. When he notices you looking at him, he hops back down onto all fours and slinks away.

You check for Metyunt in his quarters, but he isn't around. Out of curiosity, you take a look at his precious clipboard, but see nothing but scribbles and drawings of alien genitalia. And also some very nasty comments about the way you style your hair.

A loud thumping noise is coming from Metyunt's room. You open the door and are blasted with loud Slug pop music. Startled, Metyunt reaches for his tablet and switches the music to classical then slams the door shut on you.

You complain to Metyunt about a pesky insect that got on the ship during a ground expedition. He looks at your strangely, prompting you to awkwardly ask if he can take care of it. "You... want me to eat the insect? I don't know if you've noticed, but I'm not a simple primitive like my brethren. I eat normal food. Just use bug spray."
You find Metyunt staring at one of the ship walls, unmoving. You fear he might be dead, but he just tells you not to bother him. He's imagining paint drying. It's enthralling entertainment.

Metyunt advises cutting the wages of the other crew to help with spending on other elements of the ship. You consider reminding him no one's getting paid until the mission is over yet again, but decide against it.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_PONY
event.text: What do you want the pony to do?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_PONY_TAME
event.text: This action will take 1 jump and 1 drone part to perform. [Can be fully controlled x0 repair -> x0.3 repair speed x0 extinguishing speed -> x2.0 extinguishing speed x3.0 move speed -> x3.2 move speed x1.2 damage -> x1.4 damage]
You start training the horse...

removeCrew.text: Your Equinoid cannot be cloned as they are not dead.

event.text: You've finished taming the Equinoid!
You've finished taming the Equinoid!
You've finished taming the Equinoid!
You've finished taming the Equinoid!
You've finished taming the Equinoid!

textList.name: TEXT_CREW_TALK_PONY
textList.text: "Neigh!"
"Snort!"
"Whinny!"
"Grunt!"
*Stomps hooves*
*Stands motionless staring at you*

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_PONYT
event.text: What do you want the pony to do?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SPIDER
event.text: What do you want the spider to do?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_SPIDER_EVOLVE
event.text: This action will take 1{ and will replace your spider with a Weaver. [85 Health -> 95 Health x0.25 repair -> x1.5 repair speed x2.3 damage -> x2.0 damage x1.6 move speed -> x0.8 move speed Control duration 12 seconds -> 15 seconds]
Your spider undergoes the transformation...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_HATCH
event.text: What do you want the spider to do?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_HATCH_EVOLVE
event.text: This action will take 1{ and will replace your Hatchling with a spider. [50 Health -> 85 Health x0.1 repair -> x0.25 repair x1.7 damage -> x2.3 damage x2.2 move speed -> x1.6 move speed Control duration 6 seconds -> 12 seconds]
Your spider undergoes the transformation...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_QUEEN
event.text: What do you want the Queen to do?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_QUEEN_EGGS
event.text: This action will take 1 jump to complete, and will give you two Hatchling crew. Do you want to proceed?
Your Queen lays two new eggs. Remarkably, the young grow so fast that both eggs are ready to hatch by the end of the jump cycle.
